scenario_text.value: *Sigh...*
Miu... You okay?
As if. How am I supposed to be okay?
Yeah, my bad.

Y’know, Miu, I may not be able to protect
everything under the sun...

But protecting you? That I can do. So don’t
worry, okay?

Umm... Okay. I trust that more than most
things.

And thanks, I guess. For trying to cheer me
up, I mean.
Heheh.

(Professor? Why’s he staring at the two of
them like that?)

(I know he’s leaving them be, but Kaito’s
gonna be pissed if he notices.)

(This may be none of my business...but should
I cut this off at the pass?)
(Before Kaito gets upset, I should...)
Call out to Kaito.
Warn the professor.
Grab some popcorn.

Hey Kaito, Miu. It looks like the professor
wants to talk with you.

Takuma? I didn’t see you there. I didn’t
exactly have a matter to discuss. Just...

Oh yeah? But you were staring at them the
whole time.
Eavesdropping, are you? Nice hobby!
Ah, no, sorry!

They’ll think you’re eavesdropping if
you don’t say something, Professor.

Ah, no, that wasn’t my... But yes, right you
are, my boy.
Takuma?

Sorry, maybe it wasn’t my place. I didn’t
think you’d want others to listen in on this.
Naw, man, I appreciate it.
So? Did you need something, Professor?
Ah, no, nothing like that. Not exactly.

(Kaito’s not exactly a kid. If he’s gonna get
mad, why not let him do something about it?)
Oh! Professor, Takuma!
Tch, a couple of peeping Toms...

Huh? Whoa, don’t lump me in with him! I just
saw the professor looking at you two and—

Ah, I meant no offense, truly. Nor did
I intend to simply stop and stare.

I simply found myself admiring your sibling
relationship before your conversation began.
Admire? This trash fire?!
Ugh, you don’t get it at all, Professor.

Having an older brother is nothing but a big
pain!

Oh, but I do know what it’s like to have an
older sibling. I had a sister once, you know.

The feelings Kaito has for you are likely the
same as those my sister bore toward myself.
Bore, you say... As in past tense?

Oh, no. She still lives. Yes, this whole
time...
Huh?

Miu’s a pain, but all the more reason to look
after her. Wonder what his sis thought?

The younger sibling always has it rough,
that’s for sure.
